thread.title: Battered, bruised Horsemen rout Pojoaque Valley
thread.title_full: Battered, bruised Horsemen rout Pojoaque Valley

author:
Will Webber
The New Mexican
title: Battered, bruised Horsemen rout Pojoaque Valley
text:
Battered, bruised Horsemen rout Pojoaque Valley 
St. Michael’s running back Xavier Vigil, center, lunges across the goal line for a 13-yard touchdown reception as he is brought down by Pojoaque’s Logan Vigil, right, and Daniel Rael. The Horsemen never trailed in the game and rolled to a 53-18 win on Saturday afternoon at the Christian Brothers Athletic Complex. Will Webber/The New Mexican Posted: Saturday, October 10, 2015 11:47 pm | Updated: 11:54 pm, Sat Oct 10, 2015. The New Mexican SantaFeNewMexican.com | 0 comments 
The long list of walking wounded keeps getting longer for the St. Michael’s football team. 
On Saturday, it didn’t matter all that much — even with their third-string quarterback taking most of the reps.
